summary: This bill, the "Not One More Inch or Acre Act", aims to restrict the purchase of U.S. real estate by citizens and entities of the People's Republic of China. It directs the President to prohibit such purchases and, in cases of national security risk, mandate the sale of existing real estate holdings by Chinese citizens and entities. Exceptions are made for refugees and for property owned by US citizens and lawful permanent residents. Additionally, the bill amends the Agricultural Foreign Investment Disclosure Act of 1978 regarding penalties.
